info.description: runZero API. API use is rate limited, you can make as many calls per day as you have licensed assets.
info.title: runZero API

get.summary: Returns a health check status (cloud and self-hosted)

parameters.name: orgID
parameters.description: The ID of the organization to import the assets into

post.summary: Import assets described by a registered custom integration
post.description:
Assets can be discovered, imported, and merged by runZero scan tasks, first-party integrations, and third-party
defined custom integrations. See [/account/custom-integrations](#/account/getAccountCustomIntegrations). Currently only assets for custom integrations are importable here.

200.description: import task created. The task ID should be checked for its status.

Filtered asset results.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is not set in the request, the response will be a JSON array of assets.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is present in the request, the response will be an object with an assets array and a `next_key` string for pagination.

next_key.description: The key to use for the next page of results

200.description:
Filtered service results.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is not set in the request, the response will be a JSON array of services.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is present in the request, the response will be an object with a services array and a `next_key` string for pagination.

next_key.description: The key to use for the next page of results

200.description:
Filtered wireless results.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is not set in the request, the response will be a JSON array of wireless.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is present in the request, the response will be an object with a wireless array and a `next_key` string for pagination.

next_key.description: The key to use for the next page of results

200.description:
Filtered software results.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is not set in the request, the response will be a JSON array of software.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is present in the request, the response will be an object with a software array and a `next_key` string for pagination.

next_key.description: The key to use for the next page of results

get.summary: Export the vulnerability inventory as JSON

200.description:
Filtered vulnerability results.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is not set in the request, the response will be a JSON array of vulnerabilities.
  • When the `page_size` query parameter is present in the request, the response will be an object with an vulnerabilites array and a `next_key` string for pagination.

next_key.description: The key to use for the next page of results

search.name: search
search.description: A search query in runZero search query syntax

fields.name: fields
fields.description: A list of fields to export, comma-separated

pageSize.name: page_size
pageSize.description: The number of results to return per request.

startKey.name: start_key
startKey.description: The value to use for requesting the next page when requesting paginated results.  This should be the value of the `next_key` attribute returned in the previous response.

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

InternalServerError.description: Unexpected error occurred on the server

NotAllowedForLicenseError.description: Action not allowed for this license type

Problem.description: RFC7807 Problem JSON object from https://opensource.zalando.com/restful-api-guidelines/models/problem-1.0.1.yaml without the standard 'type' and 'instance' fields.

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.
title.example: A short summary of the problem type.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem that is helpful to locate the problem and give advice on how to proceed. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.
detail.example: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

updated_at.description: When the certificate was last seen in a response from a service, and updated.

names.description: An assembled list of all names in the certificate.

self_signed.description: Whether the certificate appears to be self-signed based on subject and authority.

hidden.description: Whether the certificate has been hidden from the default certificates view.

serial.description: The serial number of the certificate.

validity_end.description: When the certificate ceases to be valid.

fp_sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of the certificate.

fp_sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the certificate.

fp_md5.description: The MD5 hash of the certificate (for SSH).

attributes.description: Properties specific to the certificate type.

cn.description: The Common Name field from the certificate (no longer used by web browsers).

issuer.description: The authority which issued the certificate.

subject_key_id.description: The key ID of the subject of the certificate.

authority_key_id.description: The key ID of the authority which signed the certificate.

ocsp_server.description: Zero or more OCSP server URLs.

crl_distribution_points.description: Zero or more URLs of CRLs.

issuing_certificate_url.description: Zero or more URLs where the issuing certificate can be found.

is_ca.description: Whether the certificate claims to be a Certificate Authority.

key_usage.description: Valid purposes the certificate's key can be used for.

ext_key_usage.description: Additional purposes the certificate's key can be used for.

public_key_parameters.description: Parameters specific to the public key type.

finding_code.description: A runZero-assigned code for the finding.

rz_blog.description: URLs of relevant runZero blog postings.

private_key.description: base64 encoded private key, beginning with -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
base64 encoded private key, beginning with -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----

HealthCheckResponse.description: A health check response and version

SampleOptions.description: Options which can be set to create or modify traffic sampling.

ScanOptions.description: Options which can be set to create or modify a scan.

scan-frequency.description: A string time duration value representing execution frequency, if scheduled to repeat.

scan-start.description: Unix timestamp value indicating when the template was created.

hosted-zone-id.description: The string 'auto' will use any available hosted zone. Otherwise, provide the string name (hostedzone1) or UUID ("e77602e0-3fb8-4734-aef9-fbc6fdcb0fa8") of a hosted zone.

hosted-zone-name.description: The string 'auto' will use any available hosted zone. Otherwise, provide the string name (hostedzone1) of the hosted zone.

subnet-ping-probes.description: Optional subnet ping probe list as comma separated strings. The example shows possibilities.
subnet-ping-probes.example: arp, echo, syn, connect, netbios, snmp, ntp, sunrpc, ike, openvpn, mdns

host-ping-probes.description: Optional host ping probe list as comma separated strings. The example shows possibilities.
host-ping-probes.example: arp, echo, syn, connect, netbios, snmp, ntp, sunrpc, ike, openvpn, mdns

probes.description: Optional probe list, otherwise all probes are used

ScanTemplateOptions.description: Options which can be set to create a scan template.

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization the template will be created in

params.description: A number of scan parameter values. Currently there is no authoritative list of acceptable values. See existing templates for examples.

global.description: Whether the template is globally available to all organizations.

acl.description: A map of IDs to strings which describe how the template may be accessed. Currently there is no authoritative list of acceptable values. See existing templates for examples.

client_id.description: ID of the account which owns the template.

organization_id.description: ID of the organization the template is available in.

agent_id.description: ID of the explorer which may execute the template.

site_id.description: ID of the site the template is being used in.

cruncher_id.description: ID of the runZero cruncher the task is executing on.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp value indicating when the template was created.

created_by.description: The username of the account which created the template.

created_by_user_id.description: The ID of the account which created the template.

updated_at.description: Unix timestamp value indicating when the template was last modified.

type.description: The type of task the template creates.

status.description: The status of the last task using the template.

error.description: The error message, if any, of the last task using the template.

params.description: A number of task parameter values. Currently there is no authoritative list of in-use values. See existing templates for examples.

stats.description: A map of statistics about the last task executed with the template. Currently there is no authoritative list of in-use values. See existing templates for examples.

hidden.description: A flag indicating whether the item is hidden from common view.

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent entity of the task scheduled.

recur.description: A flag representing whether derived tasks are scheduled to repeat.

recur_frequency.description:
A string time duration value representing execution frequency, if scheduled to repeat. You may use
values including as once, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, continuous

start_time.description: Unix timestamp representing the next execution time.

recur_last.description: Unix timestamp representing the last execution if scheduled to repeat.

recur_next.description: Unix timestamp representing the next execution if scheduled to repeat.

recur_last_task_id.description: The ID of the task that last executed if scheduled to repeat.

grace_period.description: Additional time beyond hard expiration deadline by which the task may still be allowed to execute.

custom_integration_id.description: The ID of the custom integration source, if the last task executed with this template was an import of Asset Data.

source_id.description: The numeric ID of the data source, if the task executed with this template is a runZero scan or third party data connection import.

size_site.description: The size in assets of the site the last task the template was executed against.

size_data.description: The total size of result data of the last task the template was used with.

size_results.description: The number of results in the last task the template was used with.

hosted_zone_id.description: The ID of the hosted zone that ran the last task the template was used with.

linked_task_count.description: The number of tasks derived from the template.

global.description: Whether the template is globally available to all organizations.

acl.description: A map of IDs to strings which describe how the template may be accessed. Currently there is no authoritative list of in-use values. See existing templates for examples.

vulnerability_name.example: Cisco IOS Software DHCP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

vulnerability_description.example: The remote device is missing a vendor-supplied security patch.

vulnerability_solution.example: Upgrade to the relevant fixed version referenced in Cisco bug ID(s) CSCsm45390 and CSCuw77959.

directory_group_description.example: Members in this group are granted the right to logon remotely

type.description: The service the credentials are for.

comment.example: API key used for Splunk integration
Export token used for Splunk integration

Agent.description:
A deployed service which performs scan tasks.
Explorers may be referred to by their legacy name, Agents.

TaskBase.description: All fields of a Task with none required

hosted_zone_id.description: The ID of the Hosted Zone which executes the task. If the

custom_integration_id.description: The ID of the custom integration source, if the last task executed with this template was an import of Asset Data.

source_id.description: The numeric ID of the data source, if the task executed with this template is a runZero scan or third party data connection import.

TaskOptions.description: Options which can be set to create or modify a task.

hosted_zone_name.description: The string 'auto' will use any available hosted zone. Otherwise, provide the string name (hostedzone1) of the hosted zone.

HostedZone.description:
A hosted service which performs scan tasks. Hosted zones are only available to
Enterprise customers.

id.description: The ID of the hosted zone

enabled.description: Whether the hosted zone is enabled

updated_at.description: The last modification time of the hosted zone

processor_id.description: The processor ID assigned to the hosted zone

explorers_concurrency.description: The number of concurrent explorer tasks that can be executed

explorers_total.description: The number of explorers available in the zone

tasks_active.description: The number of tasks executing in the zone

tasks_waiting.description: The number of tasks waiting to execute in the zone

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization the hosted zone is assigned to

message.example: You have been invited to the runZero Network Discovery platform

BaseResponse.description: Minimal identifying information with lifecycle metadata

id.description: The unique ID of the object

clientId.description: The unique ID of the runZero client/customer account that owns the object

createdById.description: The unique ID of the entity that created the object

createdAt.description: A timestamp indicating creation time of the object

updatedAt.description: A timestamp indicating last modified time of the object

destroyedAt.description: A timestamp indicating deletion time of the object

name.description: The unique name of the custom integration, without spaces.

icon.description: Base64 encoded png with maximum size 256x256 pixels

description.description: A text description of the custom integration

NewAssetImport.description:
Represents a request to import asset data described by the specified custom integration into the specified site.

Assets will be created new or merged according to merge rules defined by the version of the platform
you are uploading the asset data file to. Typically, this involves matching network and other unique
single or grouped properties.

There is a maximum of 256 custom asset properties that can be applied to any asset. This means
that, aside from the per-import asset property limit set on ImportAsset, if a new import sets
different custom properties on the same asset, the new properties are combined with the
pre-existing ones.

siteId.description: The ID of the site assets are to be imported into.

customIntegrationId.description: The unique ID of the registered custom integration which produced the asset data. Uniqueness is not checked/enforced. See /account/custom-integrations api.

importTask.title: ImportTask
importTask.description: Information which describes the task created when asset data is imported.

description.example: importing assets from custom integration A

excludeUnknown.description: Instructs the data ingestion process whether to skip assets which do not merge into an existing asset in the asset inventory

tags.description: Arbitrary string tag values which are applied to the asset data import task created.

assetData.description:
A gzip (not .tar.gz) compressed file containing ImportAsset objects. The file data may be a JSON array of
ImportAsset objects, e.g. [{},{},...] or JSONL format, with a single JSON representation of an ImportAsset
object on each new line, e.g. {}\n{}\n...

ImportAsset.description: Represents a custom asset to be created or merged after import.

id.description: Any value which can uniquely identify the asset within the custom integration.

runZeroID.description: The unique identifier of the runZero asset to merge into.

ipv4Addresses.description: Represents IPV4 addresses. Addresses are ordered from most to least likely to uniquely identify the asset.

ipv6Addresses.description: Represents the IPV6 addresses. Addresses are ordered from most to least likely to uniquely identify the asset.

macAddress.description:
Represents a MAC address in IEEE 802 MAC/EUI-48, or EUI-64 form in one of the following formats:
  01:23:45:67:89:AB
  01:23:45:67:89:ab:cd:ef
  01-23-45-67-89-ab
  01-23-45-67-89-ab-cd-ef
  0123.4567.89ab
  0123.4567.89ab.cdef
  0123 4567 89ab cdEF

hostnames.description: Represents hostnames the asset is assigned or reachable at. These can be fully-qualified hostnames with the domain name, or a short hostname.

domain.description: Represents a single domain name which could be applied to all non-fqdns in the hostnames field.

firstSeenTS.description: Represents the earliest time the asset was seen by the custom integration reporting it, using a date string as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6.

os.description: The name of the asset's operating system. It is advisable to keep the data clean by normalizing to existing values when possible.

osVersion.description: The version of the asset's operating system. It is advisable to keep the data clean by normalizing to existing values when possible.

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the operating system of the asset. It is advisable to keep the data clean by normalizing to existing values when possible.

model.description: The hardware model of the asset. It is advisable to keep the data clean by normalizing to existing values when possible.

tags.description: Arbitrary string tags applied to the asset.

customAttributes.title: CustomAttributes
customAttributes.description: Flat map of arbitrary string key/value pairs representing custom attribute data not described in properties above. Note the maximum number of keys and length of values. Additionally, property names may only be 256 characters long.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Requires Account key (starts with CT), or OAuth

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: Requires Organization key (starts with OT), Account key (starts with CT), or OAuth

tags.name: Export
tags.description: Requires Export token (starts with ET), Organization key (starts with OT), Account key (starts with CT), or OAuth

tags.name: Import
tags.description: Requires Organization key (starts with OT), Account key (starts with CT), or OAuth
